***** Marathi[edit] *****
**** Etymology[edit] ****
Inherited from Old_Marathi 𑘭𑘩 (sala), from Maharastri_Prakrit 𑀲𑀮𑁆𑀮 (salla),
from Sanskrit शल्य (śalyá). Compare Hindustani سَال‎ (sāl) / साल (sāl, “thorn,
pain”), Sindhi سَلُ‎ / सलु, Punjabi ਸੱਲ (salla) / سَلّ‎ (sall), Nepali साल
(sāl, “afterbirth”), Oriya ସାଲ୍ (sal), ସାଲ (salô, “mortise”), Bengali শাল (śal,
“impaling stake”), Assamese শাল (xal), Sinhalese සල (sala, “arrow, dart”).
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): /səl/
**** Noun[edit] ****
सल • (sal) f
   1. hurt (emotional pain or bad experience)
